SEC.content: general possibility of “parasite”: 1) trap (piège), failure (échec), abyss outside/in front of language, ditch (fossé), place of external perdition, which language can avoid, sheltered by (à l’abri de) its essence or telos? 2) or is this risk, internal and positive condition of its possibility, this outside its inside?
SEC.linkedContent: general possibility of “parasite”: 1) trap (piège), failure (échec), abyss outside/in front of language, ditch (fossé), place of external perdition, which language can avoid, sheltered by (à l’abri de) its essence or telos? 2) or is this risk, internal and positive condition of its possibility, this outside its inside?

VM.content: for Levinas, exteriority of other is nonspatial > true exteriority is non-exteriority
VM.linkedContent: for Levinas, exteriority of other is nonspatial > true exteriority is non-exteriority

PAS.content: what does sauf mean? save them from an outside not even proper to them? sauf: secret (dérobé), powerful word, language fascinates starting form it > like sans, pas: crumbles, precludes the set from understanding itself: “rien sauf le dehors” > sauvetage project part of writing project
PAS.linkedContent: what does sauf mean? save them from an outside not even proper to them? sauf: secret (dérobé), powerful word, language fascinates starting form it > like sans, pas: crumbles, precludes the set from understanding itself: “rien sauf le dehors” > sauvetage project part of writing project

PAS.content: assimilating interiority of mastery can also be terrible thus compulsion toward outside could be defense > sauf le dehors, tout sauf le dehors
PAS.linkedContent: assimilating interiority of mastery can also be terrible thus compulsion toward outside could be defense > sauf le dehors, tout sauf le dehors

T.content: exteriority & alterity (by themselves) do not surprise philosophy > the overflow is [philosophy’s] object
T.linkedContent: exteriority & alterity (by themselves) do not surprise philosophy > the overflow is [philosophy’s] object

T.content: khōra—as tympanum, watches over its margins as virgin, homogenous, negative space, leaving its outside outside, w/out mark, w/out opposition > ready to receive and repercuss type
T.linkedContent: khōra—as tympanum, watches over its margins as virgin, homogenous, negative space, leaving its outside outside, w/out mark, w/out opposition > ready to receive and repercuss type

FS.content: Dionysus is worked over by difference, always appears (to himself) by a relationship to his exterior, his death [fire]
FS.linkedContent: Dionysus is worked over by difference, always appears (to himself) by a relationship to his exterior, his death [fire]

O.content: for Hegel, exteriority of negative still belongs to process of truth—must leave its trace upon it
O.linkedContent: for Hegel, exteriority of negative still belongs to process of truth—must leave its trace upon it

O.content: avancer qu’il n’y a pas de hors-texte absolu, ce n’est pas postuler une immanence idéale > not an idealist/theological operation, le texte affirme le dehors, deconstructs & reduces predicates of speculative operation (appropriation of outside) to “effects”
O.linkedContent: avancer qu’il n’y a pas de hors-texte absolu, ce n’est pas postuler une immanence idéale > not an idealist/theological operation, le texte affirme le dehors, deconstructs & reduces predicates of speculative operation (appropriation of outside) to “effects”

O.content: if nothing outside text, text not snug airtight (calfeutré) inside of an interiority or an identity-to-itself (d’une identité à soi) > though “dehors à tout prix” can play a reassuring role, un certain dedans peut être terrible
O.linkedContent: if nothing outside text, text not snug airtight (calfeutré) inside of an interiority or an identity-to-itself (d’une identité à soi) > though “dehors à tout prix” can play a reassuring role, un certain dedans peut être terrible

TR.content: de Man: deconstruction/dissemination independent of any desire (mechanical/arbitrary like a grammar) [Derrida quickly claims this argument is both defensible & indefensible]
TR.linkedContent: de Man: deconstruction/dissemination independent of any desire (mechanical/arbitrary like a grammar) [Derrida quickly claims this argument is both defensible & indefensible]

TR.content: event supposes the arbitrary & exteriority to desire
TR.linkedContent: event supposes the arbitrary & exteriority to desire

AFR.content: Condillac: we learn externality from touch alone
AFR.linkedContent: Condillac: we learn externality from touch alone

AFR.content: Condillac: “sensation becomes idea only by force of touch,” every touch representative of objects the hand holds; sensation of solidity: both idea and feeling, idea as feeling in soul that relates to something outside
AFR.linkedContent: Condillac: “sensation becomes idea only by force of touch,” every touch representative of objects the hand holds; sensation of solidity: both idea and feeling, idea as feeling in soul that relates to something outside

D.content: outside “illusion” of originary presence, never anything but overdetermination
D.linkedContent: outside “illusion” of originary presence, never anything but overdetermination

HST.content: since, for Levinas, the will already has relation to betrayal (“harbors treason in its own essence”), its fidelity coming from the other, the idea of a misunderstood will still reveals a relation to exteriority
HST.linkedContent: since, for Levinas, the will already has relation to betrayal (“harbors treason in its own essence”), its fidelity coming from the other, the idea of a misunderstood will still reveals a relation to exteriority

TN.content: for Freud, the spatiality of space, exteriority, is a projection of an internal, psychical extension
TN.linkedContent: for Freud, the spatiality of space, exteriority, is a projection of an internal, psychical extension

TN.content: for Psyche, for a psyche altogether exposed to outside & other, there’s no autobiography: mourning autobiography (not just any mourning)
TN.linkedContent: for Psyche, for a psyche altogether exposed to outside & other, there’s no autobiography: mourning autobiography (not just any mourning)

AD.content: Levinas’ open door calls for the opening of an exteriority or of a transcendence of the idea of infinity > idea comes through the door: the door passed through is reason in teaching
AD.linkedContent: Levinas’ open door calls for the opening of an exteriority or of a transcendence of the idea of infinity > idea comes through the door: the door passed through is reason in teaching

OG.content: w/out exteriority of signifier, there is no sign, together they keep an indestructible solidity, can’t just “move on to something else”
OG.linkedContent: w/out exteriority of signifier, there is no sign, together they keep an indestructible solidity, can’t just “move on to something else”

OG.content: acc. Rousseau, perverse, artful writing exiled in exteriority of body
OG.linkedContent: acc. Rousseau, perverse, artful writing exiled in exteriority of body

OG.content: moralism, preaching, in Saussure/Plato—casting writing, figuration, to the exterior > maléfique, sin (péché) (traitorous contamination)
OG.linkedContent: moralism, preaching, in Saussure/Plato—casting writing, figuration, to the exterior > maléfique, sin (péché) (traitorous contamination)

OG.content: dehors dans le dedans, archetypal violence, sin, interrupts natural rapport of soul w/ itself, writing, exterior, as body, as clothing
OG.linkedContent: dehors dans le dedans, archetypal violence, sin, interrupts natural rapport of soul w/ itself, writing, exterior, as body, as clothing

OG.content: writing (mask, perversion, disguise, debauchery) must be exorcised (that is, conjurer) by the good word (bonne parole)
OG.linkedContent: writing (mask, perversion, disguise, debauchery) must be exorcised (that is, conjurer) by the good word (bonne parole)

OG.content: [vis-à-vis Rousseau] transgressing space, mastering exteriority (the inanimate), arts of space carry death w/in themselves—painting, often dead, carries you to depth of desert; voice, song, more alive [?]
OG.linkedContent: [vis-à-vis Rousseau] transgressing space, mastering exteriority (the inanimate), arts of space carry death w/in themselves—painting, often dead, carries you to depth of desert; voice, song, more alive [?]

OG.content: Rousseau describes w/out declaring, en contrebande, the originary exteriority of writing: alterity
OG.linkedContent: Rousseau describes w/out declaring, en contrebande, the originary exteriority of writing: alterity

OG.content: death (not present) travels w/in speech as trace, reserve, differance, supplement; not the simple exteriority of death to life, evil to good, signifier to signified [that would be MOP]
OG.linkedContent: death (not present) travels w/in speech as trace, reserve, differance, supplement; not the simple exteriority of death to life, evil to good, signifier to signified [that would be MOP]
